name: Apple Scab
solution: Prune and dispose of infected leaves, use fungicide sprays in early spring before buds open, and promote good air circulation.
symptom: Raised, scab-like spots on fruit

name: Black Rot on Apple
solution: Remove infected plant parts, apply fungicides during the growing season, and ensure proper spacing and ventilation.
symptom: Dark lesions on fruit and leaves

name: Cedar Apple Rust
solution: Plant resistant varieties, remove nearby cedar trees, and apply fungicides as needed.
symptom: Rust-colored spots on leaves and fruit

name: Healthy Apple
solution: Maintain proper orchard hygiene, prune for good air circulation, and provide adequate nutrition.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Healthy Blueberry
solution: Proper soil preparation, irrigation, and pest management.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Powdery Mildew on Cherry
solution: Prune for better air circulation, apply fungicides, and remove infected plant parts.
symptom: White powdery spots on leaves

name: Healthy Cherry
solution: Maintain proper orchard hygiene, prune as needed, and monitor for pests.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Cercospora Leaf Spot on Corn
solution: Plant resistant varieties, rotate crops, and use fungicides if necessary.
symptom: Grayish-brown spots with yellow halos on leaves

name: Common Rust on Corn
solution: Plant resistant varieties, practice crop rotation, and use fungicides if needed.
symptom: Reddish-brown pustules on leaves

name: Northern Leaf Blight on Corn
solution: Rotate crops, use resistant varieties, and maintain proper plant spacing.
symptom: Long, elliptical lesions on leaves

name: Healthy Corn
solution: Implement good cultural practices, provide adequate nutrition, and manage pests.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Black Rot on Grape
solution: Prune for good air circulation, remove infected plant parts, and use fungicides.
symptom: Brown spots on leaves and fruit

name: Esca (Black Measles) on Grape
solution: Prune and remove infected wood, use proper pruning techniques, and apply fungicides.
symptom: Black streaks and necrosis in leaves

name: Leaf Blight (Isariopsis Leaf Spot) on Grape
solution: Prune to improve air circulation, use fungicides, and remove infected leaves.
symptom: Brown lesions with yellow halos on leaves

name: Healthy Grape
solution: Prune, maintain proper nutrition, and manage pests to ensure plant health.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Citrus Greening (Haunglongbing) on Orange
solution: Plant disease-free trees, control insect vectors, and use nutrient management to improve tree health.
symptom: Yellowing of leaves, misshapen fruit

name: Bacterial Spot on Peach
solution: Prune for better air circulation, apply copper-based fungicides, and remove infected fruit.
symptom: Dark lesions with white centers on leaves and fruit

name: Healthy Peach
solution: Maintain orchard hygiene, provide adequate nutrients, and manage pests.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Bacterial Spot on Bell Pepper
solution: Seed treatment with hot water or bleach, remove infected plants, and avoid overhead irrigation.
symptom: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit

name: Healthy Bell Pepper
solution: Implement proper crop rotation, manage irrigation, and use disease-resistant varieties.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Early Blight on Potato
solution: Remove infected leaves, apply fungicides, and use proper spacing for good air circulation.
symptom: Brown concentric rings on leaves

name: Late Blight on Potato
solution: Plant disease-resistant varieties, remove infected plant parts, and use fungicides.
symptom: Irregularly shaped brown lesions on leaves

name: Healthy Potato
solution: Practice crop rotation, provide adequate nutrients, and manage pests.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Healthy Raspberry
solution: Prune properly to improve air circulation, provide adequate nutrients, and manage pests.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Healthy Soybean
solution: Implement proper crop rotation, manage weeds, and use disease-resistant varieties.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Powdery Mildew on Squash
solution: Plant resistant varieties, prune to improve air circulation, and use fungicides.
symptom: White powdery patches on leaves

name: Leaf Scorch on Strawberry
solution: Provide proper irrigation, maintain good soil drainage, and remove infected leaves.
symptom: Browning and necrosis of leaf margins

name: Healthy Strawberry
solution: Practice proper spacing, manage pests, and provide adequate nutrition.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy

name: Bacterial Spot on Tomato
solution: Seed treatment with hot water or bleach, manage plant spacing, and use copper-based sprays.
symptom: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit

name: Early Blight on Tomato
solution: Prune lower leaves, improve air circulation, and use fungicides as needed.
symptom: Brown concentric rings on leaves

name: Late Blight on Tomato
solution: Prune and remove infected plant parts, avoid overhead irrigation, and use fungicides.
symptom: Irregularly shaped brown lesions on leaves

name: Leaf Mold on Tomato
solution: Prune for better air circulation, provide adequate spacing, and reduce humidity.
symptom: Yellowing and distortion of leaves

name: Septoria Leaf Spot on Tomato
solution: Prune lower leaves, use drip irrigation, and apply fungicides if necessary.
symptom: Small dark spots with white centers on leaves

name: Two-Spotted Spider Mite on Tomato
solution: Introduce natural predators, use insecticidal soaps or oils, and maintain good plant hygiene.
symptom: Fine webbing, stippling, and yellowing of leaves

name: Target Spot on Tomato
solution: Prune for good air circulation, apply fungicides, and remove infected leaves.
symptom: Circular lesions with rings on leaves

name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
solution: Use disease-resistant varieties, manage whiteflies, and remove infected plants.
symptom: Yellowing of leaves, leaf curling

name: Tomato Mosaic Virus
solution: Plant disease-free seeds, control aphid vectors, and remove infected plants.
symptom: Mottled, yellow-green leaves with mosaic pattern

name: Healthy Tomato
solution: Implement good cultural practices, manage pests, and provide proper nutrition.
symptom: No disease symptoms, plant is healthy
